author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Music from the Midwest, Midcoast
text:
Music from the Midwest, Midcoast Oct 01, 2015 Photo by: J. Allen Laack Wheatley Matthews 
Rockland — Rock City Café, 316 Main St., will present Wheatley Matthews Friday, Oct. 9; and Meteora Saturday, Oct. 10. The live music runs from 7 to 9 p.m. both nights. 
Matthews is from the Midwest, growing up just north of Dayton, Ohio. He made his first solo appearance in April 2014 and released a self-titled debut album five months later. This year, he recorded a large number a large number of more original songs and made his first national tour, resulting in a second studio album, "Sayonara." 
Local folk trio Meteora features Kat Logan and Jim Loney from Friendship; and Will Brown from Lincolnville. Their repertoire spans world folk, traditional, ballads, original songs, 1940s and ‘50s pop, Delta blues, Cubano, Slavic and a cappella vocal arrangements. In addition to being fine musicians, all three performers are singers. The result is tight three-part harmonies and varied instrumentation. 
Rock City’s menu is available until closing. For more information on this and other events happening at the coffeebar/cafe, call 594-4123 or find it on Facebook. 
Courier Publications’ A&E Editor Dagney C. Ernest can be reached at (207) 594-4401, ext. 115; or dernest@courierpublicationsllc.com. Meteora
